attributes.action: SECOND PETITION TO REVOKE ARTICLE 50 AND REMAIN IN EU
attributes.additional_details: There is extensive coverage in all forms of media which is informing the public as we move towards Oct 31st and a majority of authorities are of the view that a no-deal Brexit would be deeply damaging for the UK in many area such as manufacturing, agriculture and services.
attributes.background:
Since the first petition there has been substantial changes in the political situation 
1. A new prime minister and government is in place
2. The policy is to leave the EU on Oct 31st whether a deal is struck or not
3. Parliament has been prorogued.
